actions.name: Rocket Launcher (Ion) (1/Day)
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) kinetic damage. Hit or miss, the rocket then explodes. The target and each creature within 15 feet must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) ion damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. Any electronics within the blast radius that aren’t being worn or carried are disabled until rebooted.

flavor.description:
The All-Terrain Exploration Droid (AT-ED) was a model of exploration droid developed in collaboration between Cybot Galactica and Kuat Drive Yards, designed to assist in the exploration and surveying of newly discovered planets. Resembling AT-STs in a smaller package (only 2.5 meters tall), they carried a vast array of sensory and mapping instruments that allowed them to rapidly develop detailed maps of their surroundings and penetrate up to 50 meters of rock with their sensors.

Although prone to developing standoffish personalities (and both expensive and challenging to maintain), they were effective in their given tasks as fringe cartographers and scouts of places too inhospitable for organics. In comparison with Arakyd Industries' Viper Probe Droids, the AT-ED was capable of more comprehensive inspections and was clearly the superior choice where resources and terrain would allow it.

They were quickly recognizable for the bright red photoreceptor in the front-center of their chassis, which stood out even when the rest of the unit was painted in camouflage for a given environment

additionalAbilities.name: Avoidance
additionalAbilities.description: If the AT-ED is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

additionalAbilities.name: Circuitry
additionalAbilities.description: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Cunning Action
additionalAbilities.description: On each of its turns, the AT-ED can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action. Alternatively, it can use a bonus action to make a Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) check.

additionalAbilities.name: Enhanced Sensors
additionalAbilities.description: The AT-ED has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

additionalAbilities.name: Freedom of Movement
additionalAbilities.description: the AT-ED ignores difficult terrain, and effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from restraints or being grappled.

additionalAbilities.name: Sure-Footed
additionalAbilities.description: the AT-ED has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would shove it or knock it prone.

additionalAbilities.name: Surprise Attack
additionalAbilities.description: If the AT-ED surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

additionalAbilities.name: Tech Casting
additionalAbilities.description: The AT-ED is a 3rd-level techcaster. Its techcasting ability is Intelligence (tech save DC 14, +6 to hit with tech powers, 10 tech points). It knows the following tech powers: At-will: assess the situation, itemize 1st level: analyze, expeditious retreat, gleaming outline, spot the weakness, target lock 2nd level: detect traps, frequency scan, motivator boost

actions.name: Cheek Blasters
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) energy damage.

flavor.description:
High-threat recon and infiltration units, the E-XD infiltrator droids were built to resemble RQ protocol droids in their passive state. When initiating attack mode, their white optical sensors turned red, and their built-in weapons and elevated height were revealed.

One of Thrawn's scouting assets, the E-XD Series were capable of withstanding punishment in combat, possessed superior strength, and could maneuver with agility. They were also capable of rapidly scanning various objects and lifeforms and identifying them. Infiltrator droids could also cannibalize other droids and drain their power. These droids were also programmed to pilot tactical infiltration pods and to operate transmitters. Breaking Imperial protocol, the droids were fitted with a proton warhead that would self-destruct if the unit was compromised.

additionalAbilities.name: Avoidance
additionalAbilities.description: If the droid is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

additionalAbilities.name: Circuitry
additionalAbilities.description: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Passive Mode
additionalAbilities.description: As an action, the droid can transform into its passive mode. While in this mode, it is indistinguishable from a standard RQ protocol droid of size Medium, and has a movement speed of 20 feet. The droid can transform back into its attack mode as a bonus action.

additionalAbilities.name: Explosive Destruction
additionalAbilities.description: When the E-XD droid is reduced to zero hit points, it begins a countdown, and at the end of the initiative order on the following turn, it explodes. Each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) Energy damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

additionalAbilities.name: Standing Leap
additionalAbilities.description: The droid's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

additionalAbilities.name: Tech Casting
additionalAbilities.description: The E-XD is an 18th-level techcaster. Its techcasting ability is Intelligence (tech save DC 16, +8 to hit with tech powers, 23 tech points). It knows the following tech powers: At-will: assess the situation, itemize, mending, on/off 1st level: analyze, copy, countermeasures, decryption program, expeditious retreat, gleaming outline, preparedness, repair droid, spot the weakness, target lock 2nd level: detect traps, enhance droid, frequency scan, motivator boost, release, smuggle 3rd level: invisibility to cameras, read memory 4th level: scan area, synchronicity 5th level: greater analyze, override interface, skill protocol

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The droid makes four weapon attacks.

actions.name: Strike
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) kinetic damage. The target must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw; on failure, it is either grappled (escape DC 17), pushed 5 feet away, or knocked prone (the droid's choice).

actions.name: Twin Wrist Blasters
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) energy damage.

reactions.name: Cannibalize Droid
reactions.description: When the E-XD reduces another droid to 0 hit points with a melee attack, it can use its reaction to roll dice of size and number equal to the target droid's total hit dice. The E-XD regains a number of hit points equal to half the rolled sum (rounded down), up to its maximum. Any excess is granted to the E-XD as temporary hit points.

flavor.description: Shadow Troopers were an elite shock trooper unit among stormtroopers, a carryover from the clone shadow troopers of the Republic. Their distinguished, experimental black suits had installed portable cloaking devices, allowing the troopers to launch devastating surprise attacks. Paired with their heavy blasters and debilitating flash grenades, they were capable of executing devastating sabotage and guerrilla warfare missions. Their cunning served in precision strikes, where external brute force was insufficient.

additionalAbilities.name: Obscured
additionalAbilities.description: Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Perception) checks to detect the trooper by electronic sensors and cameras have disadvantage.

additionalAbilities.name: Silent
additionalAbilities.description: The trooper has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks involving sound.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The trooper makes three assault cannon, burst fire, or bash attacks.

actions.name: Assault Cannon
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 90/360 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) energy damage.

actions.name: Burst
actions.description: The trooper targets a 10 foot cube within 90/360 feet. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, or takes 11 (1d12+4) Energy damage. A target beyond 80 feet makes the save with advantage.

actions.name: Bash
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Flash Grenade (recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The trooper throws a grenade at a point within 40 feet. Each creature within 10 feet must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is blinded for 1 minute. At the start of an affected creature’s turn, it can repeat this save, ending the effect on a success.

actions.name: Stealth Field Generator
actions.description: The trooper becomes invisible. Anything the trooper is carrying is invisible as long as it is on the trooper. The trooper may end the invisibility as a free action. The invisibility ends if the trooper attacks.

languages: The languages they knew in life.

additionalAbilities.name: Martial Advantage
additionalAbilities.description: The possessed hunter can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the possessed hunter that isn't incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The possessed hunter makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

actions.name: Heavy pistol
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 45/180 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) energy damage.

actions.name: Vibrosabre
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) kinetic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.description: The possessed hunter adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the possessed hunter must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reactions.name: Follow the Leader (3/day)
reactions.description: The possessed hunter can spend a reaction to make a ranged attack against an enemy that an ally of the possessed hunter has hit and damaged with a melee attack.

additionalAbilities.name: Practical Expertise
additionalAbilities.description: The Trooper, Technician is proficient with the mechanic's kit, the security kit, and the slicer's kit, as well as three additional implements or kits of your choice.

additionalAbilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
additionalAbilities.description: The trooper, technician's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: assess the situation, ion blast, on/off, reboot, short circuit 2/day: kolto pack, spot the weakness

actions.name: Hold-out Blaster
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) energy damage.

actions.name: Welding Torch
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 ion damage.

actions.name: Repair (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: As an action, the technician can expend one use of a repair kit to restore 2d4+2 hit points to a droid or construct within 5 feet.

actions.name: Hidden Turret (1/day)
actions.description: The technician activates a hidden turret (CR 1/4, 50 xp) upon a worked metallic surface within 30 feet. The turret acts on the technician's initiative and is friendly to the technician by default.

flavor.description: In place of common stormtroopers, EVO Stormtroopers (Environmental) were deployed to fronts with extreme environmental hazards. These troopers were equipped with heavy environmental armor that granted an array of protections, and underwent additional survival training for their assignments. While some carried mid-range blasters, many utilized flechette cannons, which had additional effectiveness against hostile light vehicles and beasts native to their deployment areas. Seeing some of the worst places in the galaxy, EVO troopers were extremely hostile and xenophobic to alien species and were regularly approved to attack on sight. Galen Marek battled them on a number of planets.

additionalAbilities.name: Environmental Armor (2/Day)
additionalAbilities.description: When the trooper would make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw, it can choose to make a Constitution saving throw instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The trooper makes two burst fire attacks with its light repeater, or three bash attacks. Alternatively, it makes one flechette cannon attack and one bash attack.

actions.name: Burst
actions.description: The trooper targets a 10 foot cube within 60 feet with burst fire. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, or takes 7 (1d6+3) Energy damage.

actions.name: Flechette Cannon
actions.description: The trooper fires a volley of flechettes in a 45-foot long, 5-foot wide line, originating from itself. Each creature in the line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) Kinetic damage on failure or half as much on success.

actions.name: Bash
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) kinetic damage.

flavor.description: In response to increased hostilities against their EVO trooper deployments, the Empire produced a small number of Shadow EVO troopers to support existing and prospective outposts. Blending the technological advances of the original shadow trooper program with the environmental protections of the EVO trooper suits, Shadow EVO troopers were especially deadly. Using flechette cannons as well, they would launch ambushes and surprise attacks that would menace and decimate hostile forces and unarmed locals alike. They often targeted resistance leadership with assassination attempts, leaving enemies in disarray.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The trooper makes two burst fire attacks with its light repeater, or three bash attacks. Alternatively, it makes one flechette cannon attack and one bash attack.

actions.name: Burst
actions.description: The trooper targets a 10 foot cube within 60 feet with burst fire. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, or takes 8 (1d6+4) Energy damage.

actions.name: Flechette Cannon
actions.description: The trooper fires a volley of flechettes in a 45-foot long, 5-foot wide line, originating from itself. Each creature in the line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) Kinetic damage on failure or half as much on success.

actions.name: Bash
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Stealth Field Generator

flavor.description:
The Dark Trooper Phase Zero project was implemented in the early years of the Empire to deal with a shortage of experienced troops. To return veterans of the Clone Wars to peak condition, their limbs and organs were removed and replaced with cybernetics using much of the same technology used to transform Darth Vader into a cyborg. In some cases, over 70% of a clone's body was replaced. With their years of combat experience and cybernetic enhancements, the units that did make it onto the field were undeniably effective. However, as the subjects were forcibly recruited into the project, many Phase Zero Dark Troopers could not cope with the state of being more machine than man and attempted suicide. The project was eventually shut down as the Empire grew in power and the recruitment rate of non-clones rose.

A number of Dark Troopers served on battlefronts shortly before the Battle of Yavin. They were outfitted with Blast Cannons, SE-14r light repeating blasters, thermal detonators, ARC Casters, and Commando Pistols. They also had a jump pack.

additionalAbilities.name: Circuitry
additionalAbilities.description: The Phase Zero Dark Trooper has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal Ion or lightning damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Jump Pack (Recharge 5-6)
additionalAbilities.description: As a bonus action, the Phase Zero Dark Trooper can move double its movement speed, ignoring difficult terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The Phase Zero Dark Trooper makes two weapon attacks with its Vibro Baton, Shotgun or Blaster Carbine.

actions.name: Vibrobaton
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Shotgun
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Blaster Carbine
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) energy damage.

actions.name: Blaster Volley (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The Phase Zero Dark Trooper sprays a 10-foot-cube area within range with shots. Each creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking normal weapon damage on a failed save.

actions.name: Frag Grenade (1/day)
actions.description: The Dark Trooper throws a grenade choosing a point within 40 ft. Each creature within 10 ft. must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) kinetic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

flavor.description:
The Phase I dark trooper was the earliest dark trooper and was little more than a lightsaber-resistant phrik skeletal frame equipped with a vibrosword attached to its right arm, and a blast shield on its left. It served primarily as an installation sentry.

The Phase I dark trooper had visible power cords and couplings, which were prime weak points. The prototype of this "super trooper" had a small jump pack for short bursts of speed to increase the velocity of its vibro blades.

additionalAbilities.name: Circuitry
additionalAbilities.description: When the droid drops below half its hit points (52), the droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Phrik Skeleton
additionalAbilities.description: While the Droid has half or more of it's maximum hit points (52), the Phase One Dark Trooper has resistance to energy and ion weapons. Otherwise, it gains vulnerability to ion damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The Phase One Dark Trooper can make three melee attacks with its wrist blade or shield.

actions.name: Wrist Blade
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) kinetic damage and the target must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

flavor.description:
The Phase II dark trooper was the second and main stage of the Dark Trooper Project.

Each droid was equipped with the external elements such as the suit, a jump pack, and an assault cannon capable of firing 400 plasma shells and 20 missiles before reloading. The Phase II dark trooper was intended to be used either as an artificially intelligent droid or exoskeleton—either way, it was extremely effective in battle.

additionalAbilities.name: Circuitry
additionalAbilities.description: When the droid drops below half its hit points (65), the droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Phrik Skeleton
additionalAbilities.description: While the Droid has half or more of it's maximum hit points (65), the Phase II Dark Trooper has resistance to energy and ion weapons. Otherwise, it gains vulnerability to ion damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The Phase II Dark Trooper makes an underslung missile launcher attack and then can make three assault cannon attacks or an assault cannon barrage.

actions.name: Assault Cannon
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) energy damage.

actions.name: Assault Cannon Barrage (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The Phase Two Dark Trooper sprays a 20-foot-cube area within range with shots. Each creature in the area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking normal weapon damage on a failed save.

actions.name: Underslung Missile Launcher
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 240/240 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) kinetic damage. Additionally, hit or miss, the missile then explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 16), taking 7 (2d6) kinetic damage on a failed save.

reactions.name: Energy Shield (5/Day)
reactions.description: The Phase II Darktrooper engages its personal energy shield. Until the start of its next turn it has a +5 Bonus to its AC.

flavor.description:
The Phase III dark trooper was the last and most powerful dark trooper exoskeleton/droid. It dwarfed even the Phase II dark trooper, and was intended to be the armor of the next generation of stormtroopers. It was sometimes even classified as a bipedal tank.

The Phase III trooper's standard weapon complement included a large handheld assault cannon and two shoulder-mounted seeker missile launcher racks that were hidden under the suit's shoulder plates when not in use. They were issued additional fragmentation grenades, thermal detonators, and concussion grenades. Phase III Dark troopers wore black armor made of the nearly indestructible metal phrik, mined on the moon Gromas 16. It provided superior protection against enemy fire including energy weapons such as lightsabers. Some of the Phase III Dark Troopers also were equipped with an array of integrated weaponry, including a pair of dual blaster cannons, two in each wrist, and six PLEX rocket tubes located under the shoulder plates, three per shoulder.

The Phase III troopers were the ultimate battle droid: an amalgam of a clone's creativity, unpredictability, and initiative combined with the resilience and firepower of a heavy battle droid. However, it could also serve as an exosuit for
living soldiers.

stats.legendaryActionsDescription: The dark trooper, phase iii can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dark trooper, phase iii regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

additionalAbilities.name: Circuitry

additionalAbilities.name: Phrik Skeleton

additionalAbilities.name: Exoskeleton Capable
additionalAbilities.description: The Phase III Dark Trooper is designed to be used as a combat exoskeleton as well as a fully autonomous droid. If the Dark Trooper is being used as armor, the individual’s Str and Con mods are replaced by those of the suit. It also replaces condition immunities and damage resistances/immunities with the ones of the individual using it.

additionalAbilities.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
additionalAbilities.description: If the Phase III Dark Trooper fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you’re wielding a lightweapon or vibroweapon, and the damage is energy or ion, you can reflect the attack at a target within range as part of the same reaction. Make a ranged force attack at a target you can see. The attack has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a hit, the target takes the triggering attack’s normal damage.

additionalAbilities.description: The cultist can leap 30 ft. vertically or horizontally as part of its movement.

additionalAbilities.name: Nimble Escape
additionalAbilities.description: The master cultist can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

additionalAbilities.name: Innate Spellcasting
additionalAbilities.description: The cultist, master's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: 3/day: force lightning, choke, drain life, share life 1/day: crush, chain lightning, siphon life

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The master cultist makes four attacks, choosing from any it has.

actions.name: Crushing Grasp
actions.description: Melee Force Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d12 + 5) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Shock
actions.description: Ranged Force Attack: +10 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 5) lightning damage.

actions.name: Charged Touch
actions.description: Melee Force Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4+5) lightning damage. On a hit, the target must make a DC 18 Constitution save or be shocked until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Drain Vitality
actions.description: Ranged Force Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/320 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) necrotic damage. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength until the power ends.

reactions.name: Saber Reflect
reactions.description: In response to being attacked by a ranged weapon, the cultist raises their hands to attempt to deflect. When they use this power, the damage they take from the attack is reduced by 4d6.

stats.legendaryActionsDescription: The reborn acolyte can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The reborn acolyte regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

additionalAbilities.name: Coordinated Assault
additionalAbilities.description: If an ally of the reborn acolyte makes a melee attack and hits, the reborn acolyte can use its reaction to make a lightsaber attack.

additionalAbilities.name: Seethe (3/Day)
additionalAbilities.description: As an action or a bonus action, the reborn acolyte can gain 17 (2d12+4) temporary hit points.

additionalAbilities.name: Jump
additionalAbilities.description: As a bonus action, the reborn acolyte can jump vertically or horizontally 30 feet.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The reborn acolyte makes two lightsaber attacks.

actions.name: Lightsaber
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) energy damage.

reactions.name: Saber Reflect
reactions.description: In response to being attacked by a ranged weapon, the reborn raises their weapon to attempt to deflect. When they use this power, the damage they take from the attack is reduced by 1d6. If they reduce the damage to 0, they can reflect the attack at a target within range as part of the same reaction. The attack has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a hit, the target takes the triggering attack’s normal damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Cleave
additionalAbilities.description: If more than one enemy is within range of the reborn warrior, it can use a bonus action to attempt to cleave through on an attack, repeating the attack with the same attack roll against a second enemy, rolling damage as normal.

additionalAbilities.name: Aggressive
additionalAbilities.description: As a bonus action, the reborn warrior can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The reborn warrior makes two dual-phase lightsaber attacks.

actions.name: Dual-Phase Lightsaber
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) energy damage.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.description: As a reaction to being hit by a melee attack, the Reborn Warrior can add +5 to its AC against that attack to potentially turn the hit into a miss.

reactions.name: Saber Reflect
reactions.description: In response to being attacked, you raise your weapon to attempt to deflect. When you use this power, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 2d6. If you reduce the damage to 0, you’re wielding a lightweapon or vibroweapon, and the damage is energy or ion, you can reflect the attack at a target within range as part of the same reaction. Make a ranged force attack at a target you can see. The attack has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a hit, the target takes the triggering attack’s normal damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Nimble Escape
additionalAbilities.description: The reborn master can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

additionalAbilities.name: Aggressive
additionalAbilities.description: As a bonus action, the reborn master can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

additionalAbilities.name: Rage (1/day)
additionalAbilities.description: Once per day when the reborn master has become bloodied, it can cast the rage power as an action or bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The reborn master makes three attacks with its doublesaber, or makes two saber throw attacks.

actions.name: Cyclonic Kata
actions.description: The reborn master can make one attack with its doublesaber against every creature within reach.

actions.name: Doublesaber
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) energy damage.

actions.name: Saber Throw
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) energy damage.

reactions.name: Saber Reflect
reactions.description: In response to being attacked by a ranged weapon, the reborn raises their weapon to attempt to deflect. When they use this power, the damage they take from the attack is reduced by 3d6. If they reduce the damage to 0, they can reflect the attack at a target within range as part of the same reaction. The attack has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a hit, the target takes the triggering attack’s normal damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Cybernetic Arm
additionalAbilities.description: The roggwart's innate spellcasting ability is Strength (spell save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: 2/day: pressure crush

additionalAbilities.name: Hydraulic Leg
additionalAbilities.description: The Roggwart can leap up to 30 feet as a bonus action on its turn. When it lands it deals 5 kinetic damage to each creatures within 5 feet of where it lands.

additionalAbilities.name: Mechanized Tentacles
additionalAbilities.description: The Roggwart has four tentacles on its back. Each tentacle has an AC 10 and 5 hit points. The Roggwart gains a number of special reactions each round equal to the number of tentacles it has. Once per turn when a creature enters the Roggwart's reach or moves 5 feet or greater while within its reach, it can make an opportunity attack against that creature using its tentacles.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) kinetic damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17). While grappled in this way, the target is restrained.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Frightening Presence
actions.description: Each creature of the roggwart's choice that is within 120 feet of the roggwart and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the roggwart's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The roggwart uses its Frightening Presence, then makes one bite attack and two claw attacks. It can replace one of its claw attacks with a tail attack.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6 + 0) piercing damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Battle Droid Swarm
additionalAbilities.description: When an ally of the fireteam hits a hostile creature that it can see with a weapon attack, the fireteam can use its reaction to make one weapon attack with disadvantage against that creature.

additionalAbilities.name: Circuitry
additionalAbilities.description: The fireteam has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Reactive
additionalAbilities.description: The fireteam can take one reaction each turn.

additionalAbilities.name: Squad
additionalAbilities.description: The fireteam can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and can move through openings large enough for a Medium droid. The fireteam is immune to any power or effect that would alter its form.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The fireteam makes two blaster rifle attacks.

actions.name: Blaster Rifle
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) energy damage.

actions.name: Droid Assault
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (3d4 + 1) kinetic damage.

additionalAbilities.name: Battle Droid Swarm
additionalAbilities.description: When an ally of the battle droid hits a hostile creature that it can see with a weapon attack, the battle droid can use its reaction to make one weapon attack, with disadvantage, against that creature.

additionalAbilities.name: Circuitry
additionalAbilities.description: The fireteam has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

The fireteam makes four weapon attacks with its wrist blaster, or two attacks if it has less than half health.

Alternatively, the fireteam can make two droid assaults.

actions.name: Droid Assault
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d4 + 3) kinetic damage.

actions.name: Wrist Blaster Volley (Recharge 6)
actions.description:
The fireteam sprays a 30-foot-cube area within normal range with shots. Each creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking normal weapon damage on a failed save.
